intro: Zygogynum oligostigma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette of foliage. Its flowers, which come in various colors, are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Zygogynum oligostigma is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
